entry.title: Primary flag handling for email and phone information
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

During the recruiting process, we first collect private contact information, which has to be set as the primary contact in the system. Later, once the business contact information are created (such as the business email and phone), we want to make those the new primary contact.

However, updating the primary contact via API or import is not possible unless we also modify the original (private) contact record. It would be much more effective to derive it dynamically or allow a conditional logic‚Äîfor example: if only one phone type exists, set it as primary, or: if two phone types exist, use "business" as primary.

We‚Äôre genuinely surprised this isn‚Äôt a more widely reported issue. It causes significant challenges when integrating contact data across Recruiting, SuccessFactors, and external systems like Identity Management. In our case, business contact details come from HCM, but since the private contact information from Recruiting must be set as primary (because no other types exist yet), we cannot update the business info without also updating the existing information‚Äîbecause only one record can be marked as primary at a time.

If you are facing similar problems, we‚Äôve submitted an improvement request to make the field handling more flexible.

We‚Äôd really appreciate it if you could check it out and leave a vote if it affects you too.
Thanks a lot!

Julia

entry.title: SFSF ‚Äì Onboarding ‚Äì How to Make at Least One Document Mandatory in Work Pe
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I need to configure a business rule in SuccessFactors Onboarding to ensure that the onboardee is required to submit at least one specific document type under the Work Permit section.

In the picklist for document types, we have five different options. However, we want to make it mandatory for the onboardee to provide at least one of the following: Passport or ID Card.

How can this be implemented using a business rule?

Thanks. 

Kind Regards,

Erika

entry.title: Best Practices Employee Central Core Setup Failing with SDM Parsing Error
entry.content:
Dear SAP SuccessFactors Community,

I currently attempting to implement the Best Practices Employee Central Core Setup via the Upgrade Center. Unfortunately, the job fails with the following error:

Exception occurred while executing class BestPracticesModifySDMWithXMLParser
Exception: BPMsg ‚Äì Failed to update Succession Data Model.
Reason: Failed to parse data model.
Cleanup initiated before reading the config file.
Final result: False
Upgrade Duration: 6,252 seconds
Outcome: Upgrade Failed ‚Äì All changes rolled back

üìùNotes & Pre-checks Performed:

  1. All picklists are valid and verified in Picklist Center
  2. MDF cache has been cleared from Provisioning
  3. SDM and CSF alignment has been reviewed‚Äîfor the "fte" element
  4. Deprecated or conflicting blocks removed from the SDM

üî¥<hris-element id="directDeposit"/>
üî¥<hris-action id="planLeaveOfAbsenceAction"/>
üî¥<hris-action id="returnLeaveOfAbsenceAction"/> is removed from the SDM

I've attached both the Succession Data Model (SDM) and Country-Specific SDM (CSF-SDM). Kindly review them and let me know your feedback

‚åõThe process ran for over an hour before failing

Request for Support‚ùì

Has anyone encountered this issue or have insights into successfully parsing the SDM during this upgrade? Any guidance or workaround to complete the Best Practices setup smoothly would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance 
@SAPSuccessFactors @AllMembers

entry.title: Send email notification when an existing Termination date changes
entry.content:
We already have an email notification which is sent to a specific group of people via an email address when an employee (who meets specific criteria) is terminated.   This is already working perfectly.   However, we now want to create a separate email notification, which is sent to the same group of people if the Termination Date changes.

For example, Fred Bloggs has been terminated with an effective date in the future of, say 15 August 2025.   A notification is sent to a specific group of people to let them know of the forthcoming termination action.   However, that Termination Date might be brought forward or pushed out to a different date, say 30 August 2025.   When the Termination Date is changed, we want an additional email notification to be sent to the same group of people to let them know there's been a Termination Date change.   The email itself would simply provide the latest Termination Date for that employee, so nothing complex like previous Termination Date and current Termination Date.

I've attempted this numerous times, but the rule created to trigger the workflow (email notification) doesn't trigger.   Has anyone else done this successfully and if so, how did you achieve it?  Some other notable points:

Our Termination Date is configured as part of our employmentInfo HRIS element.   But when we change the Termination Date we essentially Edit the event date which relates to the Termination event directly from within Job Info History.  We then go into the Employment Details portlet (which is NOT effective-dated) and adjust the Payroll End Date and Last Date Worked dates accordingly.

entry.title: SAP SUCCESSFACTORS BUG REPORT
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community, please find the Details of bug highlighted below. Let me know if you have a Fix!

Details of the BUG:

This Bug has been identified in Change Job and Compensation Information for...  Transaction which only selects the Job information and not the Compensation Information. Ideally, this should also select Job and Compensation Information which is the core purpose of the transaction. But the following transaction only selects the Job information and not the Compensation Information.

 

There are separate transactions Change Job Information for... and Change Compensation for... transactions which are used for changing Job Information and compensation information separately.

entry.title: SAP SF Instance - Default Language change possible impacts
entry.content:
Hello,

What are the possible impacts and risks of changing the default language in SAP SF instance to a new one? 

The system was implemented with the default language being English and now we are seeking to completely change the default language into a new one.  We want to understand the impact this could have system wide. 

What are the main risks that should be taken into consideration if this is done?

entry.title: Change labels of the hard coded gender values in German languages
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We have a business requirement to adjust the German labels of the Gender List. The standard delivered values are currently:

  • M ‚Äì M√§nnlich
  • F ‚Äì Weiblich
  • U ‚Äì Unbekannt
  • D ‚Äì Nicht deklariert
  • O ‚Äì Sonstige

Due to legal requirements, we need the label ‚ÄòDivers‚Äô to replace ‚ÄòNicht deklariert‚Äô. Since the gender values appear to be hardcoded, could you please advise on how we can change the German labels accordingly?

Thank you!

Kind regards,
Erika

entry.title: How to schedule integrations after SuccessFactors Employee central data centers move to UTC time zon
entry.content:
Hello Experts, 

Considering the fact that all SuccessFactors data centers have moved to the UTC time zone, how can one schedule Cloud platform integrations to correctly pick up records that have become effective on a certain day?

Details - Let's assume my SF EC data center is in Tokyo. And let's also assume that I run my HRIS synch at 1 AM UTC, which is 10 AM JST. The future dated Job information records will become current dated only after the HRIS sync (I could be wrong here). So, in this case, only if I run the integration after 1:15 UTC (10:15 AM JST) will the integration pick up all the records that have become effective on that day. If I run the integration at around 4 AM, the UTC time is still 7 PM the previous day and it won't pick up the records that have become effective on the current day. 

Is there a solution to this? How can I manage to pick up all the records that have become effective on a certain day (along with changes since the last time the integration ran), when I run the integration early in the morning, when it's still the previous day in UTC time zone?

I am currently using Compound Employee SOAP call with last modified on and fromDate/toDate filters. 

Thanks

Kriba

entry.title: Login Methods - PWD, SSO
entry.content:
I am trying to determine how the Login Methods have been assigned to employees within our organisation. 

We appear to have some employees with SSO as their Login Method, some employees with PWD as their Login Method and some employees who appear to have no Login Method at all (which I understand to be the same as SSO).  It's not clear how the Login Method gets populated for an employee in SuccessFactors during the hiring/rehiring process and why some employees appear to have been created with a Login Method of SSO, whilst others have been created with a Login Method of PWD or even no Login Method at all.  How does the system actually determine which Login Method is to be used?  We don't have an Administrator setting the Login Method for individual employees during the hiring process, so the system must be determining the Login Method itself somehow.

Here's what I see in our PRODUCTION system:

  • Those employees who are assigned PWD as their Login Method seem to be either external users OR Onboardees.   We only have 6 countries set up for Onboarding at the moment. 
     
  • Those employees that have no Login Method (Login Method = null) seem to be employees that have been hired from one of the countries that is not using Onboarding.

We asked one employee who has PWD as their Login Method to sign in to SuccessFactors.  Apparently, he was able to do that without receiving any password prompt.   So, even though he has got PWD as the Login Method, he appears to be authenticating via SSO because no password was requested during the sign-on process!   How can this be?

Can anyone please clarify for me how the Login Method gets determined and populated for new employees and rehires.  Am not sure if we have Partial SSO enabled for our organisation but would assume so if we have some employees on SSO and others on PWD?

Regards

Lorna

entry.title: Association from picklist (Employee Class) to Generic Object (Country) feasibility
entry.content:
Hello experts,

Is there a possibility to associate a GO (Country) to a Picklist (Employee Class) and control the selection in the position (MDF Object)?

Eg:
During a creation of position from CANADA and show only the 4 option we have available to this country for employee class.

CANADA -> Options availlable: A, F, H and J

 

I don't want to change the system and transform cust_country to picklist.... but I think is the unique way....

During a creation of position from UNITED STATES and show only the 4 option we have available to this country for employee class.

CANADA -> Options availlable: B, D, X and Z

entry.title: Custom Task for new Hire to Complete on day 1
entry.content:
Hello,

We would like to set up custom new hire tasks for employees to complete on their first day of employment.  The tasks should appear on the employee's homepage one by one, a new one appearing after the employee has completed the previous task. Does anyone have any experience something like this?
